text:
I'm trying to use the Jakarta XSL tag library on Tomcat 4.0 (latest nightly 
build), specifying the XML file to transform using a runtime expression value, 
but Jasper seems to be ignoring the <rtexprvalue>true</rtexprvalue> in the .tld 
file.

A .war file demonstrating the problem is at http://www.talyllyn.co.uk/bug.war
creator: richardh@wrox.com
justyna.horwat@sun.com
text:
For example, in the jakarta-taglibs xsl tag:

<xsl:apply xml="<%= xmlFile %>" xsl="<%= xslFile %>"/>

A bug resulted when the first element value "<%= xmlFile %>" matched up with the
first attribute's properties. In this case, it would have been "nameXml" as
defined in the xsl.tld. "nameXml" has its rtexprvalue property set to false.

The bug fix makes sure that attribute properties match up with the correct
element. Fixed in Tomcat 4.0
